definition: (of taste) hot or pungent/hard/laborious/suffering/eighth in order/eighth of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/letter "H" or Roman "VIII" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/ancient Chinese compass point: 285°/octa
to make industrious and diligent efforts (idiom)

sentences.english: He plods away quietly in his corner.
sentences.chinese: 他在自己的角落里安静地辛勤工作着。

sentences.english: Teachers, the hard work you are the United States, the United States and the sower .
sentences.chinese: 老师，您的辛勤工作是美国，美国与播种者。

sentences.english: Is teacher's industrious education, let me learn the massive knowledge.
sentences.chinese: 是老师的辛勤教育，让我学到了大量的知识。

sentences.english: Hot weather indisposed a man to work hard.
sentences.chinese: 炎热的天气使人不愿意辛勤地工作。

sentences.english: Sooner or later, the wave will come along and knock down what we have worked so hard to build up.
sentences.chinese: 浪涛迟早会袭来摧毁我们辛勤劳动所建造起来的一切。

sentences.english: After 30 years of hard work, he became as rich as Croesus.
sentences.chinese: 经过三十年的辛勤努力，他变得非常富有。

sentences.english: They started working hard to build a new bridge.
sentences.chinese: 为了修一座新桥，他们开始辛勤劳动。

sentences.english: By hard work, many Americans have raised themselves from indigence to wealth.
sentences.chinese: 许多人通过辛勤的工作，从贫困变得富裕。

sentences.english: Then he worked still barder for the freedom of the slaves.
sentences.chinese: 此后，他为奴隶的自由而更加辛勤地工作。

sentences.english: The husbandmen that laboreth must be the first to partake of the fruits.
sentences.chinese: 辛勤耕作的农夫应该首先享受所收成的。

sentences.english: Dream about the future, but work hard today.
sentences.chinese: 对未来充满梦想，但辛勤工作于今日。

sentences.english: They see you as very cautious, extremely careful, a slow and steady plodder.
sentences.chinese: 他们认为你非常小心谨慎，节奏缓慢但一贯辛勤。

sentences.english: The second school holds that ideas are the product of hard work and thoughtful concentration.
sentences.chinese: 另一个流派认为，想法是辛勤劳动和凝神思考的产物。

sentences.english: Hard-working medical men may come to be almost as mischievous as quacks .
sentences.chinese: 辛勤工作的医生可能变成江湖郎中那样的骗子。

sentences.english: Every day, he worked his heart out in the gardens.
sentences.chinese: 每天都会在花园里辛勤劳作，呕心沥血。

sentences.english: Well, Ms. Liu, we've been very pleased with your hard work these two years.
sentences.chinese: 嗯，刘女士，我们对你这两年辛勤的工作十分满意。

definition: to make industrious and diligent efforts (idiom)
exhausting/hard/tough/arduous/to work hard/to go to a lot of trouble/hardship(s)
to be industrious, rising early and going to bed late
see 起早貪黑|起早贪黑[qi3 zao3 tan1 hei1]
night and day (idiom); continuous strenuous effort
plowing and weeding/farm work/fig. to work or study diligently
lit. to spit out one's heart and spill blood (idiom)/to work one's heart out/blood, sweat and tears
